meanings.sent1: She loves to twizzle around in her new dress.
meanings.sent2: The dancer will twizzle on stage during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to twizzle its tail but ended up chasing it instead.
meanings.sent4: The tornado began to twizzle through the town, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The toy car twizzled down the ramp at high speed.

meanings.definition: A quick spinning or twisting movement.
meanings.sent1: The twizzle of the top caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: He performed a perfect twizzle on the ice rink.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected twizzle of the squirrel's acrobatics made us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: The twizzle of the tornado was a terrifying sight.
meanings.sent5: The twizzle of the whirlpool sucked everything in its path.
